intro: Manihot gracilis var. triphylla, commonly known as the triphylla cassava, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets. The plant produces edible roots that are similar to other cassava varieties but are less commonly cultivated. Its botanical features include a stout stem, alternate leaves, and small yellow flowers that appear in clusters.
